revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=R7000 |upc=606449099843 |asin=B00F0DD0I6 |fcc_date=08/07/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H270 |manuf_rev=T00 |availability=now |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY313200233, PY318300420 |ic_id=4054A-13200233, 4054A-18300420 |pcb_id=U12H270T00 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4709A0;BCM4709A0KFEBG, TT1308, P10, E9MCJ-01, Z1C; |cpu1_cspeed=1 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B2G1646E-BCK0 |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0, USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, internal,, 3.3V TTL |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1312, P20, 273016, 3 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2623L;SKY, 2623L, 322BD;3; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 243BE, 1243 MY;3; |stock_boot=CFE |stock_os=Linux |tp_firmware=FreshTomato-ARM, Tomato (Shibby), Tomato RAF (Victek), DD-WRT (Kong-AC ARM) |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=04:A1:51, 44:94:FC |oui_eth=04:A1:51, 44:94:FC }} {{TagLine|Nighthawk AC1900 Smart WiFi Router}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.netgear.com/home/products/networking/wifi-routers/R7000.aspx}} {{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=R7000}}
Per the FCC test report... *The device seems to be [[Broadcom]] based :(the testing utility is ''Manual Tool v2.0.1.0'') *The supporting WLAN AC card is stated to use BCM4360
Netgear requested FCC certification for the R7000 again on 12/17/2018 under [https://fccid.io/PY318300420 PY318300420]. This version has been internally redesigned, likely to cut manufacturing costs. Some minor components (RAM/FEM/etc.) may have changed but the same Broadcom chips are still used.<!--{{FCC ST|06/16/2019}}-->
===News=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-news/32229-netgear-joins-the-ac1900-club ''NETGEAR Joins The AC1900 Club'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :[[Broadcom]] BCM4709A0 (''BCM4709A0KFEBG'') + 2x BCM4360 ::There is a single USB 3.0 port on the front of the unit ::and a single USB 2.0 port on the rear of the unit :This device seems to be functionally equivalent ::(or quite similar) to the [[ASUS RT-AC68U]]
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32239-ac1900-first-look-netgear-r7000-a-asus-rt-ac68u ''First Look: NETGEAR R7000 & ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] **"U12H270T00", "801466", "REV.1 GP" is silkscreened on the board **states the device is using [[Broadcom]] BCM4709A + BCM4360 ::3x [[Skyworks]] (''SiGe'') SE2623L PAMs for the 2.4GHz radio ::3x [[Skyworks]] (''SiGe'') SE5003L1 PAMs for the 5GHz radio *[http://reviews.cnet.com/hubs/netgear-nighthawk-ac1900-smart/4505-3335_7-35828277.html ''Netgear Nighthawk AC1900 Smart Wi-Fi Router (R7000)'' on '''C|Net'''] :04:A1:51 OUI, ''NETGEARXX'' SSID, states this device uses BCM4709 *[http://www.pcworld.com/article/2050761/netgear-nighthawk-review-this-802-11ac-router-sets-lan-speed-records.html ''Netgear NightHawk AC1900 Smart R7000 Router'' on '''PCWorld'''] *[https://lookgadgets.com/10-best-wireless-routers/#2_NetGear_NightHawk_AC1900_8211_R7000_Fastest_overall_throughput_and_slick_design ''Netgear NightHawk AC1900 R7000 Router'' on '''LookGadgets''']
===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=177443 ''Netgear R7000'' on the '''DD-WRT''' forums]
===See also=== *[[Netgear R6900P]] - ''AC2300 Smart WiFi Router'' :• FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/PY316200351 PY316200351] (11/15/2016) 12V/3.5A - 1x USB 3.0 *[[Netgear R7000P]] - ''AC2300 Smart WiFi Router'' :• FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/PY316200351 PY316200351] (11/15/2016) 12V/3.5A - 3T3R BCM
